title: Ticket #5017: SCHEDD per-user stats should be published in Submitter ads
description: The SCHEDD keeps track of per-user Transfer stats, and can be configured to keep track of per-user job counts - These stats are all currently published in the SCHEDD ad. It would be better if they were published in the various Submitter ads instead.
remarks:
2015-Apr-23 15:35:11 by bbockelm:
Be aware -

The transfer queue statistics are based on the queue setup which defaults to "per user". However, locally and in CMS, we use a separate queue setup (per site).

No qualms with publishing things for the default values, but please keep the queue setup a configuration knob.

2015-Apr-23 15:42:58 by johnkn:
I'm aware that per-user is configurable via TRANSFER_QUEUE_USER_EXPR, if you change that knob to be something other than the default, then that will defeat the code that attempts to lookup per-user transfer stats - with the result that you don't in-fact get transfer stats in the submitter ad.

Out of curiosity, what do you set TRANSFER_QUEUE_USER_EXPR to?

2015-Apr-23 22:07:07 by bbockelm:
Sounds good - just wanted to make sure we're on the same page.

I forget the precise expression, but it's something like:

TRANSFER_QUEUE_USER_EXPR = strcat( MATCH_EXP_GLIDEIN_CMSSite, ".", Owner)

2015-Jun-04 14:51:18 by johnkn:
With this change, the submitter ad can now have the following transfer attributes. All attributes mean the same as the schedd attrib of the same name, but count only jobs owned by the given submitter.

There is a known bug in the current code such that if a jobs that have +AccountingGroup or NiceUser will be counted separately from other jobs by that user.

2015-Apr-27 09:38   Check-in [44728]: Publish per-user stats in submitter ads #5017 This commit changes the schedd's OwnerData structure (used to create submitter ads) from a vector to a map and makes the structures persistent rather than having count_jobs destroy and re-create them. per-owner SCHEDD stats are created automatically and published [...] (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
